alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 9:28AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Grimes, southeastern Burleson, southeastern Brazos, central Washington and western Walker Counties through 1015 AM CST... At 928 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from College Station to near Burton. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... College Station, Brenham, Navasota, Washington, Somerville, Burton, Millican, Anderson, Lake Somerville Dam, Carmine, Independence, Quarry, Wellborn, Roans Prairie and Carlos. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
